deities.name: Indra
deities.description: King of gods, wielder of vajra (thunderbolt), slayer of demon Vritra. Most prominent deity in Rig Veda.

sampleHymns.title: Indra Slays Vritra
sampleHymns.excerpt: I will declare the manly deeds of Indra, the first that he achieved...

sampleHymns.title: Who is Indra?
sampleHymns.excerpt: He who gave being to the Sun and Morning, who leads the waters...

sampleHymns.title: Praise of Indra
sampleHymns.excerpt: Come, magnify with song the mighty Indra...

deities.name: Agni
deities.description: God of fire and sacrifice. Mediator between humans and gods, consumer of offerings.

sampleHymns.title: Opening Hymn to Agni
sampleHymns.excerpt: I praise Agni, the priest, the divine minister of sacrifice...

sampleHymns.title: Agni as Mediator
sampleHymns.excerpt: We choose Agni as our messenger, the all-possessing...

sampleHymns.title: Dialogue with Agni
sampleHymns.excerpt: What sin have we committed, O Agni, that you turn away?

deities.name: Soma
deities.description: Personification of sacred soma drink and lunar deity. Source of divine inspiration.

sampleHymns.title: Soma Pavamana
sampleHymns.excerpt: Flow onward, Soma, in your juice, in your clearness...

sampleHymns.title: Where Immortality Dwells
sampleHymns.excerpt: Where light is perpetual, in the world where the sun is placed...

deities.name: Varuna
deities.description: Guardian of cosmic order (rita), lord of waters and night sky. Punisher of oath-breakers.

sampleHymns.title: Prayer for Forgiveness
sampleHymns.excerpt: If we have sinned against the man who loves us, against a friend or comrade, O Varuna...

sampleHymns.title: Hymn to Varuna
sampleHymns.excerpt: Whatever law of thine, O God, O Varuna, as we are men, day after day we violate...

deities.name: Ushas
deities.description: Goddess of dawn, bringer of light and consciousness. Most prominent female deity.

sampleHymns.title: Praise of Dawn
sampleHymns.excerpt: This light has come, of all lights the most lovely, the bright effulgence has been born, far-shining...

sampleHymns.title: Ushas the Awakener
sampleHymns.excerpt: She hath shone brightly like a youthful woman, stirring to motion every living creature...

deities.name: Surya
deities.description: Sun god, source of light and life. Eye of Mitra and Varuna.

sampleHymns.title: Hymn to Surya
sampleHymns.excerpt: The brilliant presence of the Gods hath risen, the eye of Mitra, Varuna, and Agni...

deities.name: Maruts
deities.description: Group of storm deities, companions of Indra. Fierce warriors with golden armor.

sampleHymns.title: The Maruts
sampleHymns.excerpt: Like brilliant heroes, active in their valor, the Maruts have clothed themselves in flowing garments...

deities.name: Ashvins
deities.description: Twin gods of dawn, divine physicians and rescuers. Always invoked together.

sampleHymns.title: Deeds of the Ashvins
sampleHymns.excerpt: Nasatyas, you who glide in your chariot among the waters...

deities.name: Vishnu
deities.description: The wide-striding one who measured the universe in three steps. Less prominent than in later texts.

sampleHymns.title: Vishnu's Three Strides
sampleHymns.excerpt: I will declare the mighty deeds of Vishnu, who measured out the earthly regions...

deities.name: Rudra
deities.description: Fearsome storm god with healing powers. Father of the Maruts. Precursor to Shiva.

sampleHymns.title: Prayer to Rudra
sampleHymns.excerpt: Father of Maruts, let thy bliss approach us: exclude us not from looking upon the Sun...

deities.name: Mitra
deities.description: God of friendship, contracts, and oaths. Often paired with Varuna.

sampleHymns.title: Mitra and Varuna
sampleHymns.excerpt: To Mitra and to Varuna sing forth your song, ye men...

deities.name: Pushan
deities.description: Protector of travelers and cattle. Guardian of roads and pathways.

sampleHymns.title: Prayer to Pushan
sampleHymns.excerpt: Pushan, bring us to the man who knows, who will tell us...

deities.name: Vayu
deities.description: God of wind and breath. Often invoked with Indra.

sampleHymns.title: Vayu and Indra
sampleHymns.excerpt: Vayu, to thee who art beautiful of aspect comes the offering...

deities.name: Parjanya
deities.description: Rain god and fertility deity. Waters the earth with his seed.

sampleHymns.title: Hymn to Parjanya
sampleHymns.excerpt: Speak out with thunder, roaring, slay the demons, pour down the rain-flood...

deities.name: Yama
deities.description: First mortal, king of the dead. Son of Vivasvat, twin of Yami.

sampleHymns.title: Hymn to Yama
sampleHymns.excerpt: Honor the King with thine oblations, Yama, Vivasvat's Son...

deities.name: Savitar
deities.description: Solar deity who stimulates and impels all beings. Associated with the Gayatri mantra.

sampleHymns.title: Gayatri Mantra
sampleHymns.excerpt: We meditate on that excellent glory of the divine Savitar...

deities.name: Prithivi
deities.description: Earth goddess, mother of all. Often paired with Dyaus (sky).

sampleHymns.title: Heaven and Earth
sampleHymns.excerpt: Great are the Heaven and Earth, liberal, sublime...

deities.name: Apas
deities.description: Personification of waters. Purifying and life-giving.

sampleHymns.title: Hymn to the Waters
sampleHymns.excerpt: Waters, you are healing; bring us strength and health...

deities.name: Ratri
deities.description: Goddess of night, sister of dawn. Protective and peaceful.

sampleHymns.title: Hymn to Night
sampleHymns.excerpt: Night has come, looking around on many sides with her eyes...

deities.name: Dyaus
deities.description: Sky god, father of gods. Consort of Prithivi (Earth).

sampleHymns.title: Heaven and Earth
sampleHymns.excerpt: These, Heaven and Earth, bestow prosperity on all...

deities.name: Aditi
deities.description: Mother of the Adityas (solar deities). Personification of infinity.

sampleHymns.title: Prayer to Aditi
sampleHymns.excerpt: May Aditi make us safe, with all her succors...

deities.name: Brihaspati
deities.description: God of prayer and devotion. Divine priest and teacher.

sampleHymns.title: Hymn to Brihaspati
sampleHymns.excerpt: Brihaspati, the Rishi, the leader of singers...

deities.name: Vac
deities.description: Goddess of speech and sacred knowledge. Personification of the word.

sampleHymns.title: Vac Speaks
sampleHymns.excerpt: I am the Queen, the gatherer-up of treasures, most thoughtful...

deities.name: Vishvedevas
deities.description: Collective group of all gods. Often invoked together.

sampleHymns.title: To All the Gods
sampleHymns.excerpt: May the great Gods be gracious unto us...

deities.name: Ribhus
deities.description: Divine craftsmen who became gods through their skill. Created miraculous objects.

sampleHymns.title: Deeds of the Ribhus
sampleHymns.excerpt: The Ribhus, with the Asvins and with Indra...

deities.name: Tvashtar
deities.description: Divine architect and craftsman. Creator of forms and beings.

sampleHymns.title: For Progeny
sampleHymns.excerpt: May Tvashtar fashion for you a pair of twin children...

metadata.source: Based on Rig Veda Samhita analysis
metadata.note: Hymn counts are approximate and include both primary and secondary mentions
